definition[0]: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person
definition[1]: the crime of making false spoken statements about someone
example[0]: He is being sued for slander.
definition[2]: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
definition[3]: a spoken statement about someone that is not true and is intended to damage the good opinion that people have of him or her, or the legal offence of making a statement of this kind
example[1]: The company is being sued for slander by four pharmacists who say the retailer publicly ruined their reputations.
definition[4]: to say untrue things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
example[2]: Smith slandered him by accusing him of proposing an illegal business deal.
